title: Head of Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand
description:
With all brands in the Traton group moving towards a common way of working with product structure in Traton Modular System (TMS) there will be opportunities to co-operate between brands also when it comes to presales preparations and ways of introducing new content to the market. During last year Scania, MAN, Navistar and Hero identified opportunities for cooperation by sharing systems and processes but also in the actual work of taking product data from R&D and moving it to each brand that makes its work with it to make it commercially right in the market.
   

  

 Presales Multibrand is a function within Presales and Sales Readiness that will be hosted by Scania but will support all brands and the joint activities in that area. If you are interested in shaping the future and finding our ways forward together in the group, then this is the job for you. You will work in the management structure of the function Presales Multibrand as head of the group Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The group Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand is a newly created group in the Presales Multibrand function. As the manger for this group you will lead a team of very experienced people and have a key role in the interface to the Multibrand work in MAN, Navistar, Hero as well as Scania. You need to be able to have a long-term view of how this, until now, unexplored area can develop but also an ability to act here and now to ensure high-quality introductions of new product structure and product information.
   

  

 The Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand team consists of experienced and highly motivated team members in the areas of Continuous Introduction, Product Coordination and Product Information. Their responsibilities are content in the presales systems and work a lot in the interface towards R&D but also towards our business units and other departments.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As head of Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand you will lead a group responsible for monitoring and coordinating the inflow of product updates from R&D and doing the necessary preparations of these product updates that will make it possible to move out to the commercial organizations in each brand. You will also develop our ways of working to meet requirements in a new Multibrand context where we have all brands collaborating in a way we have never worked with before.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You are a strong and highly motivated leader with a strategic mind but can act here and now. Previous management experience or other proven skills of leading people are of importance. You can work in a cross-functional and cross-brand environment and are interested in a holistic view of how the industrial and commercial systems work together to deliver results.
   

  

 New thinking, open-mindedness, driving change and cross-functional work should come naturally. The role will take you to many different environments, internally as well as externally so you will need to be competent in handling cultural differences and master English fluently. Swedish is not required. If you have managerial experience with any of the Traton brands and a background in cross-brand (collaborative) work we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 At Presales and Sales Readiness we celebrate differences and care deeply about diversity and inclusion – please motivate in your cover letter how your passion, attitude, experience and interest make you the perfect match for this position.
   

  

 If you think that you are suitable for this position, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

**Further information and application**
 For more information, please contact Sara Ekman, Head of Multibrand Product Structure Introductions, KJX, +468 553 860 65.
   

  

 The position is available from 1st of September and I kindly ask you to apply as soon as possible as the last day for application is 30th of June.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: SQL Developer
description:
Role: SQL developer
 



 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





 Description: We are looking for a person with technical skill when it comes to T-SQL, SSIS
 



 You should also have an understanding in the savings area preferable within funds and equities.
 



 Main responsibility will be development/test of our migration platform.

title: Senior IT Auditor | Stockholm
description:
Do you have a passion for technology and information security? Would you like to join SEB's ambitious digitalization journey and help us navigate the ever-evolving threat landscape? Then you should join our enthusiastic and qualified technology audit team.
   

  

 This role sits within Group Internal Audit which is an independent group-wide function with a global presence, comprising approximately 80 auditors. We evaluate and give assurance on the governance, risk management and internal control framework of SEB and report directly to the Audit and Compliance Committee (ACC) of the Board. The global technology audit team comprise of six colleagues in Sweden and three in the Baltics.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a member of our team, you will assess SEB's risk exposure related to technology and information/cyber security and contribute to the development of our audit strategy. You need to stay on top of the threat landscape, the regulatory environment, and how new technologies, new ways of working and a growing ecosystem alter SEB's risk posture. You will also use your skills and creativity to develop and deploy smart ways of testing effectiveness of implemented controls.
   

  

 You will participate in and lead audit assignments spanning areas such as cyber security, technology platforms, business applications, privacy, outsourcing/cloud, governance, risk management, and more. You will assist other teams within Group Internal Audit to identify and assess technology related risk within business processes and perform integrated audit assignments. You will also provide guidance and support to the organisation in the implementation and enhancement of controls. The team has a global reach so occasional travelling is part of the job.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 You have a genuine interest and proficiency in technology, cyber security and risk management. You could either have a technical or auditor background, working in roles such as solution architect, senior developer, IT security officer, internal/external auditor, or similar. Experience from a Big4 audit firm, exposure to the financial industry, and hands-on experience as a developer or technician is meriting. You are eager to learn and continuously develop, and either possess or are willing earn relevant certifications, such as CISA, CISSP, CISM, etc.
   

  

 Ideally you have experience in one or more of the following areas:
   

  

* IT audit, security testing, risk management or similar
* IT governance, development, and operation processes
* Cloud technology and security
* Programming and scripting
* Third party risk management
* Data analytics
* Technology and security risk assessment
* Industry standards such as ISO27k, ISF SoGP, CIS18, NIST CSF, COBIT, etc.


 You have a Master’s/Bachelor's degree in the IT field, or equivalent experience, and have proven skills in professional English report writing.
   

  

 Finally, you are dedicated, curious and self-propelled in your assignments. You are a team player but can deliver independently on time and scope with minimum supervision. You are structured and have strong project and time management skills. You are also an excellent communicator with the ability to build trust and relationships at all levels in the technology and business organisations.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Flexible and empowering work environment
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* International opportunities and working environment
* Friendly and welcoming culture


**Ready to take the next step on your career journey?**
 You are welcome to apply by attaching your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to this position. Considering the summer vacation, we will not start the recruitment process until August. You are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than August 18, 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Martin Aronsson, Head of IT Audit, at martin.aronsson@seb.se or Karl Saeter, Talent Acquisition Partner, at karl.saeter@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Företag inom IT-infrastruktur söker Field Service Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Är du en tekniskt kunnig och lösningsorienterad person med erfarenhet inom datacenter? Vill du vara en del av ett innovativt företag som ligger i framkant av IT-infrastruktur och tekniska lösningar? På uppdrag av kund söker vi nu en driven och engagerad Field Service Infrastructure Engineer för att stärka deras team och bidra till deras fortsatta framgång. Om du brinner för att leverera högkvalitativ teknisk support och vill arbeta i en dynamisk och utvecklande miljö, då kan detta vara möjligheten för dig!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, Skift
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augusti
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 På uppdrag av kund söker vi nu en skicklig Field Service Infrastructure Engineer som kan arbeta på plats i deras kunders datacenter. Denna roll är avgörande för att tillhandahålla omfattande teknisk support till deras kunder och säkerställa smidig drift och distribution av kritisk datacenterinfrastruktur. Du kommer att bestå av ett team med nio kollegor med en spridning mellan kontoren i Borås och Stockholm. Det kan förekomma även förekomma jobb på annan ort.
 


  


 Kunden är ett ledande teknikföretag specialiserat på avancerade datacenterlösningar och IT-infrastruktur. De levererar tjänster inom bland annat datacenterinfrastruktur och IT-drift, säkra kommunikationslösningar, containertjänster, service och support 24/7, säkerhetslösningar, applikationsdrift och tredjepartsservice. De har strategiska partnerskap med ledande tillverkare och referenslösningar hos flera av Nordens mest krävande IT-verksamheter i både den privata och offentliga sektorn.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En dynamisk och stimulerande arbetsmiljö.
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt.
  
* Möjligheter till vidareutbildning och professionell utveckling.
  
* En tillsvidareanställning via Academic Work med fast månadslön. Goda möjligheter till överrekrytering efter 6 månader.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Incidenthantering för kontinuerlig drift.
  
* Hantering av olika datacenteraktiviteter, såsom att byta ut nätverksenheter, konfigurera servrar, utföra strömcykler och hantera kabeldragning/patchhantering.
  
* Generera periodiska rapporter enligt kundens specifikationer.
  
* Tillhandahålla logistiskt stöd för tillgångshantering och datacenterplanering.
  
* Delta i felanalys enligt anvisningar från kundens ingenjörsteam.
  
* Resor inom tjänsten kan förekomma
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har examen inom ett datorrelaterat område (datorvetenskap, elektroteknik, telekommunikation eller liknande).
  
* Har 2 till 5 års relevant teknisk support-erfarenhet.
  
* Har stark kunskap om lagring, nätverk och serverhårdvara.
  
* Är en lagspelare
  
* Innehar B-körkort
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Certifiering inom CompTIA A+ eller motsvarande, CompTIA Server+ eller motsvarande, MCP/MCSE-certifiering.
  
* Bred erfarenhet inom nätverk och hårdvara
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Flexibel
  
* Kommunikativ
  
* Noggrann
  
* Problemlösare
  
* Prestigelös
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sophia Gyllenhammar eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105308

title: Krav- och testspecialist
description:
**Välkommen till en grön värld av möjligheter hos oss på Sveaskog. Vi erbjuder dig skogen – en vacker arbetsplats och framför allt ett av våra viktigaste bidrag för att klara utmaningar kopplade till klimatförändringar och framtidens råvaruförsörjning. Nu söker vi dig som är teamorienterad och vill vara med oss på resan.**
**Vi erbjuder**
 Att arbeta på Sveaskog innebär stor frihet samtidigt som du förväntas ta ansvar, visa mod och vara nyfiken. I allas uppdrag ingår att ta ansvar för sin egen och verksamhetens utveckling samt att vara teamorienterad och en bra kollega. Vi kallar det aktivt medarbetarskap. Vi erbjuder dig attraktiva förmåner och en arbetsplats som kännetecknas av en vilja att du ska lyckas, där jämställdhet och hållbart arbetsliv står högt på agendan. Sveaskog eftersträvar mångfald och en jämn könsfördelning inom alla yrken i företaget.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Enheten för Digitalisering och IT befinner sig på en spännande resa och nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och driva utveckling och förvaltning av ett antal av våra system. Som Krav- och testspecialist söker vi dig som är bekväm med att arbeta i en roll som Kravspecialist och Testledare/Testspecialist i ett av våra utvecklingsteam, där du kommer att arbeta nära den skogliga verksamheten i ett av våra affärsområden. Våra utvecklingsteam använder Scrum och jobbar i enlighet med ramverket SAFe.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Delta i utveckling och förvaltning av Sveaskogs system
* Proaktivt föreslå justeringar och kvalitetshöjande åtgärder i våra system
* Tillsammans med teamet utveckla arbetssätt och leveransförmåga
* Säkerställa information och IT-säkerhet i vår IT-miljö
* I rollen Kravspecialist föra dialog med produktägare och användare om behov för att sedan tillsammans med teamet implementera dessa samt verifiera innan produktionssättning
* I rollern Testledare/Testspecialist arbeta för hög kvalitet tillsammans med teamet i hela utvecklingsprocessen ända fram till leverans.


 Stationering på lämpligt Sveaskogkontor med goda kommunikationsmöjligheter för resor i Sverige.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Du har en relevant akademisk examen eller motsvarande kompetens. Du har god erfarenhet av krav och/eller testarbete, helst i en ledande roll. Du är van vid agil utvecklingsmetodik, dev-ops och att arbeta med komplexa lösningar. Då vi arbetar agilt med ramverket Safe är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet av detta sedan tidigare.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Du är strukturerad, drivande och målinriktad med hög samarbetsförmåga. Du är prestigelös och genuint intresserad av att tillsammans med andra leverera hög kvalitet till våra användare.
   

  

**Vill du bli vår kollega?**
 Den här rekryteringen genomförs i samarbete med Forefront Amplify på uppdrag av Sveaskog.
   

  

 Ansökan sker via formuläret här
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 2 september. Sök snarast då vi tillämpar löpande urval i vår rekryteringsprocess och rollen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

**Har du frågor?** 
 Kontakta Emma Andersson, ansvarig rekryterare, via [email protected].
   

  

 Fackliga kontaktpersoner är för Ledarna Thomas Esbjörnsson, tel 010-544 99 75, för Akademikerföreningen Sara Östh, tel 010-544 97 11 och för Unionen Stig Sjöberg 08-655 90 58.
   

  

**Om Sveaskog**
 Sveaskog är Sveriges största skogsägare och ägs av svenska staten. Bolaget äger 14 procent av Sveriges skogsmarker och har cirka 800 medarbetare runt om i landet. Våra kontor finns från Tärendö i norr till Osby i söder.

title: Linux Desktop Support Associate
description:
This is an opportunity for an entry level technologist with a passion for Linux and Customer Success to build a career with Canonical and support the technical needs of customers and Canonical staff. If you have a passion for technology and an eagerness to learn, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 The role of a Linux Desktop Support Associate at Canonical
   

  

 You will be accountable for delivering an outstanding technical support experience to our employees and customers. From problem qualification to full resolution, you will own and manage your cases. When needed, you will transfer your cases to your colleagues or involve senior engineers.
   

  

 Your day to day job is to provide technical expertise, be an excellent communicator and service-oriented professional. Every day you will have to make judgement calls to prioritise customer issues and maximise your effectiveness. You will also need to set time aside to learn about our new products and technologies and evolve as a professional. You will participate in various training sessions, team gatherings and Company events.
   

  

 Location: This role will be based remotely in EMEA and Americas regions
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

 Your day to day duties will include:
   

  

* Work from your remote home office and provide technical support for employees.
* Provide technical onboarding support for new employees.
* Provide technical and infrastructure support during international events.
* Be available to take ownership of new cases via telephone, email, and web
* Act as an internal customer advocate keeping them updated in a timely manner
* Ensure that each support request owned by you is handled as per our Service Level Agreement (SLA) and to the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments
* Contribute your findings to a common knowledge base and keep it up to date
* Draft and distribute technical notices for internal and external communication.
* Prioritise your work in order to accomplish the most important and urgent tasks first
* Keep on learning as our products and services grow and evolve
* Maintain regular communication and information exchange with the rest of the team, locally and remotely
* Identify and suggest any opportunities to provide a better service


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Bachelors or equivalent four year degree in a technical field from an accredited college or university. Preferable majors: Computer Science, MIS, Electrical Engineering, etc.
* Experience in a Linux based environment gained through university subjects or work experience
* Linux knowledge including the installation, troubleshooting and basic configuration of recent Ubuntu Desktop releases
* Basic desktop Linux usage (desktop tools for editing files, browsing the Web, managing Internet connectivity, setup of printers/services/packages/external storage devices/etc. utilising command line tools for exploring and manipulating the file system)
* Basic troubleshooting (collecting logs, basic fine-tuning by editing configuration files)
* Familiarity with safely installing, uninstalling, reinstalling, and repartitioning machines running Ubuntu Linux and recovering broken installations
* Understanding of Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Applications, and Single Sign-On.
* Ability to learn quickly, thrive on change, and handle the pressure of a customer facing job
* Written and verbal English communication skills
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Some knowledge of programming (bash, python, Perl, Ruby, Javascript, C or C++, Go)
* Customer support experience is a plus


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Staff Engineer
description:
This is a general track for Staff Engineer or above in any team at Canonical. After the first round of interviews we will establish which teams might be an excellent fit, and progress your application with them.
   

  

 Canonical delivers open source to the world across every class of compute. Canonical Ubuntu is the world's favourite Linux for cloud, desktop and IoT. Our engineering teams work on operating systems, programming languages, applications, devices, infrastructure and services. We work in Golang, Python, C, C++, and Rust for system services, and use React and Flutter on the front end.
   

  

 In our levelling framework, a Staff Engineer is not only an outstanding software architect and coder, they also demonstrate the leadership qualities needed to work across teams and products, enabling others to create outstanding technologies and communities. A Staff Engineer partners with an Engineering Director, who is also code-capable, and together they take responsibility for product outcomes. We hire based on academic results and proven product execution, and we select those with a passion for open-source software, innovation, and cutting-edge technology. In this role, you will make a significant contribution in Canonical's portfolio through high-quality code, technical leadership, team motivation and direction, exceptional design, and crisp documentation.
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer you'll drive the architecture, design and evolution of high-impact open source. Our teams work at every level of the stack. From the kernel and system software at the core of Ubuntu through to major language runtimes and the bleeding-edge of cloud automation and distributed systems, you'll have the opportunity to work on complex but highly rewarding projects. Our teams also build the services which deliver Ubuntu to the world, on cloud, devices, servers and PCs.
   

  

 Additionally, this role will give you the opportunity to engage with the broader open-source community. We're looking for individuals who can help build a thriving community, contribute to a broad range of technologies, and ensure seamless software operations at scale.
   

  

 Location: we have remote opportunities for Staff Engineers in every time zone.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Lead design and architecture of an impactful open source project
* Code in Golang, Rust, Python, C/C++ or Typescript / React
* Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
* Mentor, develop and advise colleagues in their career progression
* Display technical leadership in Canonical and our communities
* Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
* Contribute to technical documentation with the aim to make it the best of its kind
* Work from home with global travel twice annually for company events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Technical leadership as well as team motivation, direction and pace
* Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
* Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Deep experience with at least one of Go, Rust, Python or C
* Subject matter expertise in your engineering domain
* Conscientiousness and detail orientation, with a focus on performance
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience with container technologies such as LXD, Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience with highly concurrent, distributed systems
* Experience with embedded systems
* Performance engineering – from kernel to web – benchmarks, optimisation
* Experience with software security – fuzzing, tabletop threat models, analysis, audit
* Experience build systems and toolchains, including for cross-compilation
* Experience with public clouds or OpenStack
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu packaging
* Experience with systems programming or scalable web services
* Deep quality and test engineering
* Web or Flutter front-end experience
* REST and gRPC API experience
* SQL and NoSQL data store expertise
* Experience with public clouds or OpenStack
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu packaging
* Experience with systems programming or scalable web services


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit globally and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Technical Account Manager
description:
**🕹️Technical Account Manager** 




**🕹️Location: Stockholm (onsite 1-2 days per week)** 




**🕹️Salary: Competitive (SEK)** 




  





 We are supporting an ambitious Gambling company in the heart of Stockholm. They have been providing top quality online gambling games for 10+ years. As part of their growth, they are on the hunt for a Technical Account Manager to help them shift to the next level. If you are looking for a new opportunity and want to work in a fast paced, positive, and challenging environment then keep reading.
 



  





 Responsibilities:
 



  




* Troubleshoot any issues throughout and after the integration process
* Incident management
* Be responsible for ongoing integration support and testing
* You will be responsible for dealing with configuration requests
* Monitor ticket queues and alerts to resolve issues



  





 Requirements
 



  




* You will need to have experience working with API’s
* Ability to work in a fast moving environment
* Any gaming industry experience would be a plus
* People person as you will be speaking to customers
* At least 3 years experience in a similar position



  





 It would be great to discuss this opportunity further. If you are interested please apply here. interviews will be taking place ASAP.
 



  





 PLEASE NOTE YOU WILL ONLY BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU ARE LIVING IN STOCKHOLM OR CAN COMMUTE TO THEIR OFFICE IN STOCKHOLM AT LEAST ONE TIME PER WEEK.

title: Junior SAP Data Consultant
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
   

  

 “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” –
 **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO.**
**About our Nordic SAP Business Group:**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking for candidates on several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**SAP Data Nordic Value Tower:**
 Within the SAP Value Tower Data, we offer you the opportunity to work with SAP Data and to grow your knowledge within the area of Information Management, connected to SAP MDG, Master Data Management and Data Migration.
   

  

 We are looking for people who have a genuine interest in Data, want to grow and challenge themselves within that area and work with the best skilled colleagues.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 As a junior SAP Data Consultant in Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group, you will be an integral part of our team supporting our clients SAP transformation projects through acting as a Functional Expert in the Data Migration and/or Data Governance areas. You will work closely with clients, translating their business and functional requirements into SAP design documents and overseeing solution delivery.
   

  

**Example project roles:**
- Advise clients on their data transformation strategies, driving value creation through the positioning of SAP enabled solutions as well as leading solutions from SAP partners and Accenture

- Be part of the data migration stream of an S/4HANA transformation, working with colleagues in delivery centers to execute on their data transformation and data upload strategies

- Work with clients on their transformational journey, by implementing Master Data Governance strategy and processes, following SAP best practices and Accenture’s proven ways of working

**What’s in it for you:**
- Help Accenture deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity

- Be part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery

- Enjoy competitive compensation and benefits

- Develop your skills and build an extraordinary career

- Grab significant development and training opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills

- Get internal coaching, support and guidance from a mentor, to progress in your work and professional career with continuous feedback

- Gain access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert networks and benchmarks

- Combine business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how

- Transform businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies

- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects

- Play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

**Qualifications**
**Must have:**
- Deep interest in the importance of Data

- Passion about innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Strong resonance with Accenture’s values

- Motivation, persistence, eagerness to optimize and drive for excellence

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility and to be a team player

- Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

**Very nice to have:**
- Experience with Data Migration and/or Data Governance

- Previous exposure to or user of SAP

- Knowledge in a functional or business process area

- Technical development (programming) background

**Locations**
 Gothenburg, Malmö, Stockholm

title: Cyber Defence DevOps Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 The Cyber Defence Centre (CDC) is a key security function at H&M Group, forming the last line of defence verifying and supporting other security controls, safeguarding company staff and assets 24/7.
   

  

 We are a friendly and collaborative team that work closely with analytics and other security functions within the group. We have a responsibility to develop, setup, manage set requirements on systems and services that are used by security analysts.
   

  

 It is crucial to this role that you are familiar with Infrastructure as Code, Terraform, Containers and a CI/CD pipeline way of working. We do not expect you to know everything; we learn as we go with modern technologies.
   

  

 We think you have previously worked in or with \*nix shells and have no problem navigating shell in VM’s or containers.
   

  

 Example of the work our team is doing:
   

  

* Sentinel optimization
* Develop automized tools and processes
* Maintain and improve current solutions
* Parse and ingest new log sources
* Continuously improve cooperation with other security teams
* Creating patch, updates and architectural processes and routines adhering to all sorts of security regulations
* Improve way or working in the team as well as towards other teams


**Qualifications**
**What you need to succeed:**
* Broad and deep knowledge in Python and/or Azure, as well as any other security toolset that you have
* Ability to navigate in \*nix and have your favorite shell and maybe even a favorite prompt
* An interest in security field with at least an overall knowledge of ISO standards, security frameworks and understanding of log handling and ingestion.
* Willingness to learn modern technology stacks/services
* A positive spirit and attitude


**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden and we have a hybrid work structure.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Responsibilities**
 Leya runs on data. As a Data Engineer at Leya, you'll be the backbone of our data operations, playing a pivotal role in making legal insights more accessible. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Data Pipeline Development: Design and build robust, scalable data pipelines to support our AI models. You'll ensure the smooth flow of data from various sources, making it ready for analysis and deployment in our AI tools.
* Database Management and Optimization: Oversee our databases. You'll focus on optimizing data storage and retrieval, ensuring speed and efficiency while maintaining data integrity and security.


 Who you are
   

  

* Strong track record in data engineering
* Experience with data modeling, warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
* Preferably experience with vector databases
* Excited to join a start-up and to contribute where you see opportunities
* Eager to be part of the LLM revolution

title: Technical Support - HVAC
description:
**Position Summary**
 Help Us Create What Can’t Be Done
   

  

 Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence—and an unfaltering commitment to develop the best products and services on the market. In today’s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company’s survival. As we have done for over 80 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success. As our new member in technical support, you will have an integral part in ensuring we stay on top of the market and continue to enrich and simplify the lives of our partners and installers.
   

  

 Samsung continues to grow and is now looking for a technical support person for our Air Conditioning (Aircon) Team. In this role, you will support our installers and service people by email, team meetings, or phone. You will guide them with information, measurements, and guides on installation and service.
   

  

 You will be part of a close-knit and experienced team, reporting to Johan Berggren. Our office is in Kista. You can expect travel within the Nordics on planned visits. Meeting our distributors as well as visiting installations and local installers.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 We work with the product group Climate Solutions. Including everything from residential products like air to air and air to water. We also have a large range of products suitable for Commercial Applications. E.g. VRF systems for hotels, offices, and shops.
   

  

 In this role, you will be the technical support for our installers and distributors. You will support them with the correct manual, support with service guides, settings in parameter menus, measurements of the components, a guide to repair units, etc. You will help with troubleshooting products and read wiring and circuit diagrams.
   

  

 Some of the tasks include:
   

  

* Daily technical support to installers via E-mail, Phone, Chat, direct meetings, and Teams.
* You will hold training both at our training center and on-site to distributors technical teams, installers, and consultants
* In between create guides and videos for installers to support them on site
* You will together with the team set a strategy to have the best service in the business.


**We do things differently:**
 In line with Samsung’s “Do what you can’t” we work differently. Our support department is important for us and our customers. We have different opening hours, during the high season between 7:00 – 18:00. We will adapt the working hours to what suits you the best of course.
   

  

 You will travel to support our sales team between 10-20 days in a year, but more if it suits you. We educate on-site for requested product groups.
   

  

 We want to develop new tools to support our customers. At times, you might be the project leader, implementing new tools that we choose to work with.
   

  

 We will train you in everything needed regarding our products, and if you are curious about an area and want to specialize, we are happy to support you. If you are ambitious, your next step in our organization could be to become a Product Manager, work with Pre-Sales, or become a Sales Rep. We will do what we can to support your ambition.
   

  

**Skills And Qualifications**
 In this role, you need to have good communication skills and be able to guide, handle, and support different customers and stakeholders in both Swedish and English. You need to have a pedagogical approach while doing it.
   

  

**We are looking for someone with:**
* Documented experience in technical support.
* A good understanding of troubleshooting technical products remote
* A good understanding of how electricity works. Ability to read electrical diagrams, and ability to in a structured way guide an installer in the electrical systems and controllers
* Good knowledge of Microsoft 365 (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
* Driver's license (Swedish B-körkort)
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish as well as English


**It’s a merit if you also have:**
* Support experience in within HVAC
* Speak one of the other Nordic languages. Danish, Finnish, or Norwegian.


 Samsung is a dynamic company in a fast-moving industry, there are many opportunities to grow and develop! In order to enjoy working with us you must be a person who appreciates tempo, change and takes initiatives.
   

  

 Some of our benefits include:
   

  

* A result-based bonus
* Staff Sales and discounts
* ITP pension and possibility for salary exchange program
* Insurances
* Fully equipped gym
* A fantastic team spirit where we support each other


 …And more!
   

  

 Selection and interview process is ongoing; please apply as soon as possible. We look forward to getting your application!
   

  

**#** 
**LifeAtSamsung**
**Samsung Fast Facts**
**#DoWhatYouCan't**
* Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location, at: https://account.samsung.com/membership/policy/privacy. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here: https://europe-samsung.com/ghrp/PrivacyNoticeforEU.html

title: Back-Office medarbetare på deltid till Endress+Hauser!
description:
Är du strukturerad, noggrann och har en fallenhet för administration? Till Endress+Hauser söker vi nu dig som vill ta dig an tjänsten som Back-Office medarbetare. Läs mer om tjänsten nedan och skicka in en ansökan om det är dig vi söker!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Endress + Hauser Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 HR/kontor/administration
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Deltid, 20h/v
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 1 september
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Endress+Hauser är en världsledande leverantör av mätinstrument, service och lösningar för processindustrin. Företaget har de senaste åren haft en hög tillväxt och behöver därför en Back-Office medarbetare för att bidra till verksamhetens befintliga organisation. Här blir du del av ett härligt gäng som verkligen bryr sig om varandra och har roligt tillsammans, samtidigt som du får värdefull erfarenhet för framtiden.
 


  


 I tjänsten som Back-Office medarbetare får du möjlighet att ta dig an en meriterande och bred roll. Du kommer att stötta IT-, HR- och Ekonomiavdelningen med diverse administrativa arbetsuppgifter. För att trivas i rollen krävs det att du är noggrann, strukturerad och motiveras av att stötta dina kollegor.
 


  


 Tjänsten är ett bemanningsuppdrag via Academic Work som förväntas pågå minst ett år. Det innebär att du kommer anställas hos oss och arbeta som konsult hos Endress+Hauser. Arbetstiderna är förlagda under kontorstid och du kommer tillsammans med din närmsta chef bestämma vilka tider och dagar du arbetar.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Hantera dokument, scanna fakturor, skicka betalningspåminnelser
  
* Personaladministration, on/off-boarding av anställda
  
* Intern IT support, beställning av arbetsverktyg, installation av datorer/telefoner
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Studerar på eftergymnasial nivå och har minst 1 år kvar av studier
  
* Har arbetat administrativt tidigare
  
* Har intresse för teknik och IT
  
* Har mycket god datorvana & goda kunskaper i Office Paketet
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i Svenska och Engelska då bägge språken används i det dagliga arbetet
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Arbetat i en liknande tjänst tidigare
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  


 För att passa för tjänsten krävs det att du är mycket strukturerad och noggrann. Du är social och trivs med att ta kontakt med olika personer då du kommer stötta flera avdelningar samtidigt. Vidare är du prestigelös och alltid redo att hjälpa till där det behövs.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Alina Finnberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105287

title: Är du vår nya fältservicetekniker?
description:
Nu har du chansen att bli en del av vårt dynamiska team inom Production Service hos Canon Svenska AB. Vi ansvarar för att våra kunders produkter inom bildhantering, skanning, utskrift och kopiering fungerar optimalt. Det inkluderar även att se till att programvara för produktion och kommersiell utskrift fungerar som den ska. Nu söker vi en driven person som vill arbeta som fältservicetekniker med fokus på att lösa våra kunders problem både på plats och på distans via våra digitala verktyg. Vi letar efter en kollega som brinner för att ge utmärkt service och som är skicklig på problemlösning.
   

  

 I den här tjänsten kommer du att ingå i ett team med tekniker som är utplacerade runt om i Sverige. Distriktet sträcker sig från Mälardalen till Sundsvall med utgångspunkt från Stockholm. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med övriga kollegor i teamet. Tjänsten berättigar till tjänstebil.
   

  

**Vad vi ger**
 Hos Canon får du stöd och uppmuntran från kollegor som delar dina ambitioner och hjälper dig att lyckas och växa. Vi investerar i din professionella utveckling. Våra ledare ger dig friheten att prova nya saker och du ingår i en kultur där vi delar våra framgångar och lär av varandra.
   

  

**I den här tjänsten kommer dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter att vara**
* Lösa incidenter eller problem med hårdvara och/eller programvara i kundmiljön, både på plats hos kund och via digitala hjälpmedel.
* Utföra förebyggande och korrigerande service på våra Canon-produkter.
* Samarbeta med våra olika avdelningar på Service & Support.
* Kommunicera om eventuella uppföljningsåtgärder.
* Sköta och administrera reservdelslager.
* Känna igen, adressera och kommunicera kundsignaler och kommersiella möjligheter för att uppnå bästa resultat för kunden och Canon.


**Vad vi förväntar oss av dig**
**För att lyckas i rollen som fältservicetekniker tror vi att du**
* Har ett starkt intresse för teknik och IT.
* Är kundfokuserad, lösningsorienterad, proaktiv och resultatinriktad.
* Är kommunikativ, strukturerad och trivs med ordning och reda.
* Är van att arbeta självständigt och trivs med frihet under ansvar.
* Är en lagspelare som delar kunskap och färdigheter med dina kollegor för att bidra till ett starkt team.
* Har kunskap i Microsoft Office (Outlook, Teams, Word etc).
* Behärskar svenska och engelska väl i både tal och skrift.
* Innehar B-körkort.


 En utbildning inom teknik/IT ses som meriterande.
   

  

**Du kommer att behöva**
 För att lyckas i denna tjänst tror vi att du är organiserad och trivs med att ge utmärkt service till våra kunder. Du är dessutom en proaktiv problemlösare som är van vid god tidsplanering och som ständigt implementerar förbättringsprocesser. Vi tror också att du har en stark drivkraft och beslutsamhet att lyckas.
   

  

**Ytterligare Information**
 Har du frågor gällande tjänsten, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef via john.svard@canon.se . Har du frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta HR via olivia.agne@canon.se .
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Under semestertider kan vår återkoppling ta något längre tid. Vi ber om din förståelse och återkommer till dig så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Kyosei** 
 är Canons företagsfilosofi och innebär ”att leva och arbeta tillsammans för allas bästa”. Med filosofin som ledord försöker Canon i alla rekryteringar skapa en arbetsplats som återspeglar mångfald och öppenhet. Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss på vår karriärsida https//www.canon.se/careers/
   

  

 Canon berikar människors liv och företags verksamheter på häpnadsväckande nya sätt. Du kan bli en av oss och forma framtiden för ett starkt, ambitiöst och hänsynsfullt företag. Tillsammans gör vi skillnaden. Du kan förvänta dig de exceptionella och uppnå det exceptionella, med världens bästa bildföretag.
   

  

 Living and working together for the common good.

title: 2nd line support till världsledande företag inom bild- och printteknik!
description:
Här kommer din chans att ta nästa steg i karriären och kliva in i rollen som 2nd line support hos vår innovativa och framåtlutade kund Canon. De är världsledande inom bild- och utskriftslösningar och kombinerar banbrytande teknik med en stark företagskultur för att berika människors liv och företagsverksamheter. Här blir du en del av ett engagerat och ambitiöst team och en självklar nyckelspelare på en arbetsplats där både stark gemenskap och individuell utveckling främjas.
   

 Kyosei är Canons företagsfilosofi och på japanska betyder det ”att leva och arbeta tillsammans för allas bästa”. Med filosofin som ledord försöker Canon i alla rekryteringar skapa en arbetsplats som återspeglar mångfald och öppenhet.
 



  

**Företag :**
 Canon Svenska Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Här blir du en del av Canons 2nd Line Support i rollen som Solution Business Consultant inom utskriftshantering och kommer tillsammans med kompetenta och erfarna kollegor arbeta med företagets världskända produkter som ligger i framkant. Du kommer att supportera och implementera lösningar för ett brett spektrum av Canons kunder och vara en del av ett engagerat team om sju personer baserade i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.
   

 För den här rollen söker vi dig som är organiserad, proaktiv och kundorienterad och som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med support och mjukvaruinstallationer. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av att leda projekt och drivs av att utveckla, förändra och effektivisera arbetssätt är det här den perfekta rollen för dig.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  


 Hos Canon får du stöd och uppmuntran från kollegor som delar dina ambitioner och som är måna om att hjälpa dig att lyckas och växa. Detta är en arbetsplats som investerar i din professionella utveckling med ledare som ger dig friheten att ständigt prova nya saker. Här blir du snabbt en del av en kultur där framgångar delas med varandra och där man lär sig av sina kollegor. För att hjälpa dig att lyckas erbjuds du både intern och extern utbildning och du får arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt som verkligen gör skillnad för företagets kunder.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Supportera kunder, framför allt på distans via telefon.
  
* Optimera företagets applikationer och processer för utskriftshantering hos deras kunder.
  
* Installera och införa nya system och processer/rutiner hos kund.
  
* Felsöka kundsystem och hårdvara.
  
* Förbättra och öka säkerhetsfunktioner i våra kundmiljöer.
  
* Delta i och medverka i workshops.
  
* Ge instruktioner, utbilda och dokumentera.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har förståelse för Microsoft server och dess komponenter, såsom AD/Nätverk/SQL.
  
* Har en utbildning inom IT/Teknik/Data eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
  
* Besitter erfarenhet av att arbeta med kundrelationer och support.
  
* Har läst en utbildning eller har erfarenhet inom datasystem, arkitektur och nätverk.
  
* Påvisar kunskap inom installation och drift av datasystem.
  
* Har goda kunskaper i MS Office.
  
* Är van vid att arbeta i projekt.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Kommunikativ och kan uttrycka dig väl både skriftligt och muntligt på svenska och engelska.
  
* En teamspelare med lätt för att samarbeta med både kollegor och kunder.
  
* Ansvarsfull, noggrann och tar stort ägandeskap.
  
* En duktig problemlösare som gillar att ge utmärkt support och service till kund.
  


  

  

  

  

  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på filippa.karlberg@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105132

title: DevOps Engineer (CI/CD & C#) - API Platforms
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Job Description**
 If building and maintaining technology platforms excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The API Platform team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer who will play a critical role in designing, implementing and maintaining the deployments and integration processes for H&Ms API platform. The platform enables our product teams around the world to deploy software solutions that run independently. You will be part of a high-performance team that constantly aims to improve the experience of our end users and you. In this role, you will also be partnering with teams and areas to support our unit in driving the integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap.
   

  

 Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Work on ways to automate and improve development and release processes
* Identify technical problems in the pipelines, implement software updates and fixes
* Evaluate, build and implement new development tools and infrastructure
* Ensure systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
* Deliver on time, demonstrating strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Align on CI/CD guidelines/guardrails with our Developer Experience Unit
* Drive refactoring of legacy systems, to help enable decoupling and modernize the software architecture
* Build the simplest possible solution that fulfils functional and quality requirements
* Actively apply best practices within CI/CD
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation
* Work with software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years IT experience with at least 6 years working with Cloud technologies (Azure, GCP)
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementing and managing Azure DevOps pipelines and YAML-based pipeline configurations
* Hands-on with languages & tools relevant to CI/CD Pipeline implementation e.g. .NET, C#, PowerShell, Bash etc.
* Good expertise and experience with DevOps services administration, monitoring and troubleshooting of pipelines
* Hands-on with managing and troubleshooting coupled integrations for SCM, Key Vaults, Logging and alert systems etc.
* Experience leveraging IaC (Infrastructure as Code) for deployment automation using Terraform, ARM template etc. on Microsoft Azure & Google Cloud Platform
* In-depth experience with API management platform (Azure preferred)
* Hands-on experience with Azure CLI and/or PowerShell & REST API
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Experience with industry best practices, strategies and troubleshooting for integration, build and deploy capabilities.
* Knowledge and experience in deployment using GitHub actions is highly desirable
* Knowledge and experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is meriting
* Preferred to have at least Azure Administrator (AZ104) and/or Developer (AZ204) certifications
* Azure Solution Architect (AZ305) and/or DevOps Engineer (AZ400) are strong plus!
* Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker and Kubernetes) is meriting
* Ability to design, document and clearly communicate ideas or issues
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools like Jira/Confluence, Miro etc.


**Additional Information**
 Working with tech at H&M Group
   

  

 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30th of June. We will review and interview applicants on-going. If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Hranda Khrystyna at khrystyna.hranda@hm.com

In this role, you will also be partnering with teams and areas to support our unit in driving the integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap.
   

  

 Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Work on ways to automate and improve development and release processes
* Identify technical problems in the pipelines, implement software updates and fixes
* Evaluate, build and implement new development tools and infrastructure
* Ensure systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
* Deliver on time, demonstrating strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Align on CI/CD guidelines/guardrails with our Developer Experience Unit
* Drive refactoring of legacy systems, to help enable decoupling and modernize the software architecture
* Build the simplest possible solution that fulfils functional and quality requirements
* Actively apply best practices within CI/CD
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation
* Work with software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years IT experience with at least 6 years working with Cloud technologies (Azure, GCP)
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementing and managing Azure DevOps pipelines and YAML-based pipeline configurations
* Hands-on with languages & tools relevant to CI/CD Pipeline implementation e.g. .NET, C#, PowerShell, Bash etc.
* Good expertise and experience with DevOps services administration, monitoring and troubleshooting of pipelines
* Hands-on with managing and troubleshooting coupled integrations for SCM, Key Vaults, Logging and alert systems etc.
* Experience leveraging IaC (Infrastructure as Code) for deployment automation using Terraform, ARM template etc. on Microsoft Azure & Google Cloud Platform
* In-depth experience with API management platform (Azure preferred)
* Hands-on experience with Azure CLI and/or PowerShell & REST API
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Experience with industry best practices, strategies and troubleshooting for integration, build and deploy capabilities.
* Knowledge and experience in deployment using GitHub actions is highly desirable
* Knowledge and experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is meriting
* Preferred to have at least Azure Administrator (AZ104) and/or Developer (AZ204) certifications
* Azure Solution Architect (AZ305) and/or DevOps Engineer (AZ400) are strong plus!
* Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker and Kubernetes) is meriting
* Ability to design, document and clearly communicate ideas or issues
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools like Jira/Confluence, Miro etc.


**Additional Information**
 Working with tech at H&M Group
   

  

 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30th of June. We will review and interview applicants on-going. If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Hranda Khrystyna at khrystyna.hranda@hm.com

title: Innovative Developers to Scania I-Talent 2024!
description:
For the eighth time, Scania is starting its highly regarded I-Talent Program! This program is designed for those with a strong drive to develop, who are eager to contribute new ideas, and who want to be part of the effort to drive the transition towards a more sustainable transport industry! If you are graduating in 2024 or have a maximum of a couple of years of experience in your IT career, this is for you!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Scania CV Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Södertälje/Hybrid
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 September 2024
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Scania is one of Sweden's largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Their mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing a safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries and together with partners and customers they are driving the transition towards a more sustainable transport industry and are both trend setters and pioneers in electrification and sustainable transport systems.
 


  


 Together with several other I-talents, you will be offered a unique chance to participate in a program that will kick-start your journey at Scania. You are employed in a specific role and belong to a team but alternate the work in your role with meetings together with the other I-talents. The program starts every fall and is designed for you who are new in your career and aim to give you the best possible conditions to grow into your role. I-talent Program consists, in addition to daily work in your team, mainly of three parts - "Learning your professional role", "Go-and-see" and "Training". This provides very good opportunities to build a good network within Scania and in addition to your I-talents colleagues and your closest manager, you will be assigned a buddy who will be there for you the first time. At Scania, you are offered a multicultural work environment with ambitious colleagues and a company that invests in leadership. There is room for everyone to grow here, regardless of whether you want to be a generalist, specialist, or a leader. If you have the right attitude and are motivated to take responsibility, you will have all chances to develop!
 


  


  

**CI-Machine**
  

 As part of this team, you will belong to Scania R&D and be welcomed into an experienced, competent, and forward-thinking team that works with the CI-Machine – a new functionality that will be crucial for Scania's ambition to be a market leader in innovative solutions. The goal of the CI-Machine is to create an automated pipeline – an "integration-as-a-service solution" that enables designers to build, configure, and trigger tests for both software and hardware within the entire Scania modular system. Here, you will work with cutting-edge CI/CD development and operate fullstack with JAVA, Python, and AWS cloud. Your work will ultimately contribute to shorter lead times in production, improved environmental impact, and cost efficiency within Scania as well as Traton Group.
 


  


 Today, the team consists of 10 people, but there are great ambitions to grow, and we are looking for several i-Talents to join this team. You will be welcomed into a multicultural group from all over the world that enjoys each others company both on and off the job. The team works in a hybrid model between the office in Södertälje and remotely from home.
   




**We are looking for**
  
* A post-secondary education in computer science, electronics, mechatronics, network engineering etc.
  
* Knowledge or experience in Java, python or other programing language
  
* Knowledge or interest in testing
  
* Very good knowledge in English as it´s the primary language you will use in your daily work
  
* Highlt meritative with Swedish language proficiency
  


  

  

****The recruitment process****
  

  
* Phone interview with Academic Work
  
* Tests (problem solving + personality)
  
* In-depth interview with Academic Work
  
* Interview with Scania
  
* References + decision
  


  


  

**Additional information**



  

  
* Start: 1st september 2024
  
* Full-time, fixed-term employment for 6 months with a good chance of extension
  
* Location: Södertälje, with the possibility of remote work a few days a week
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work. Main recruiter, Emelie Säfbom, emelie.safbom@academicwork.se
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 Read more about the program!
   




**Get directly recruited to Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Emelie Säfbom or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stn05@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105425

title: Tester to market leading company within auditing
description:
If you are motivated by solving problems and ensure that projects and tasks are being solved in the best possible way, then this is the role for you! We are now looking for an experienced tester who is eager to continue to develop within testing and quality assurance. You will be part of a team full of knowledge and experience at a company that always strives towards high quality in their products. Don't hesitate - submit your application today!
 


 Apply here!

**About the role**

 We are now looking for an driven tester on behalf of our client for an assignment that starts after the summer. Our client is the market leader in Sweden in auditing, accounting and consulting with 50,000 clients all over Sweden. Their vision is a well-functioning, sustainable business and society that inspires trust. Here, knowledge is central and the employees' knowledge, expertise and experience are highly valued. They are driven by their ingenuity, expertise and the latest technology to create added value for their customers.
 


  


 Our clients IT department is growing and they are in the process of building a new structure within their team. They are now looking for their next talented colleague to help strengthen their team in this transition. As a member of their team, you will be given the opportunity to be innovative and make a big difference while ensuring high quality in their products and processes. You will work together with the developers and strive to find the most effective solutions together, and be involved in solutions to making their product reach an even higher quality level through continous and thourough testing.
 


  


 You will have the possibility to work partly remote, but in the beginning we prefer that you work mostly from the office to get to know the organisation and your colleagues. This is an assignment that will last for about 10-12 months from the start date.
 


  


  

**You are offered**

**We are looking for**

* Some years of experience of manual testing
  
* Experience of databases and SQL
  
* Experience of API and test integrations
  
* Experience of CI/CD pipelines
  
* Experience of Visual Studio code
  
* Used to an Agile workflow

 Being fluent in Swedish is not a requirement, but since our client's main company language is Swedish we consider knowledge in Swedish as a meritorious skill, and it's important that you're willing to learn.
