title: R&D Software Process Owner
description:
**R&D Software Process Owner**
==============================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. Write the next chapter of your ABB story.**

### **This position reports to**


R&D Global Unit Lead

### **Your role and responsibilities**


In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute significantly to successful project results in technology, software, product, and/or solution development, as well as associated Intellectual Property (IP). Each day, you will act as the first point of contact in Research and Development for specific product-related issues and maintenance. You will also showcase your expertise by identifying, proposing, and implementing innovative solutions. The work model for the role is hybrid. This role is contributing to the Electrification Smart Power Innovation & Product Platform. You will be mainly accountable for: • Designing, documenting, and implementing software development processes tailored to the specific needs and goals of the R&D department, considering factors such as project complexity, resource availability, and technology stack.Finding new ways of solving problems by following your ideas, creating hypotheses, and defining ways to validate them • Ensuring that software development processes comply with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices, such as ISO, FDA, or industry-specific requirements, to maintain quality and regulatory compliance • Evaluating and selecting appropriate software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall, DevOps) based on project requirements, team dynamics, and organizational objectives, and overseeing their adoption and execution • Establishing and maintaining quality assurance measures, including code reviews, testing strategies, and quality gates, to ensure the delivery of high-quality software products that meet customer expectations and stakeholder requirements. Leading SW QMS website development, tracking and refining requirements, and maintaining the SW QMS website • Identifying bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement in the software development process, and leading initiatives to optimize workflows, enhance productivity, and reduce time-to-market • Collaborating closely with R&D teams, software developers, project managers, and other stakeholders to align software development processes with project goals, facilitate effective communication, and foster a culture of collaboration and transparency • Providing training, guidance, and support to R&D staff on software development processes, tools, best practices, and methodologies, ensuring that team members have the necessary skills and knowledge to succeed in their roles • Identifying and mitigating risks associated with software development processes, including security vulnerabilities, compliance issues, and project dependencies, to ensure the successful and timely delivery of software projects

### **Qualifications for the role**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
* 10 years of experience in software development process management, software engineering, or a related role, with a strong understanding of software development methodologies and best practices
* Knowledge of relevant regulations, standards, and guidelines governing software development processes, such as ISO 9001, FDA 21 CFR Part 11, or industry-specific requirements
* Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools, with the ability to oversee multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders, build consensus, and drive change in a dynamic and collaborative environment
* Analytical mindset, with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions to optimize processes and improve performance
* Certification in relevant areas such as Project Management (PMP), Agile (e.g., Certified Scrum Master), or Quality Management (e.g., Six Sigma), experience working in regulated industries (e.g., healthcare, aerospace, automotive) with compliance requirements for software development, and familiarity with software development tools and technologies commonly used in R&D environments, such as version control systems, issue tracking systems, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, are preferred

### **More about us**


ABB Smart Power provides energy distribution solutions for data centers, industrial and manufacturing plants, critical infrastructure and commercial buildings. The Division’s technical teams work closely with industry partners, delivering advanced solutions that support rapid growth, energy transition, and sustainability objectives. The Division’s portfolio includes industrial circuit breakers, low-voltage systems, motor starting applications, and safety devices like switches and relays. Its Power Protection unit supports the world’s largest data center companies with advanced energy-efficient UPS solutions. The Division’s ABB Ability™ Energy Manager provides a scalable, easy-to-use platform that helps organizations save energy and reduce CO2 emissions. We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Senior NOC / DevOps3
description:
Om du är en driven och engagerad IT-Systemtekniker som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär, är du välkommen att ansöka till oss!
  
OM JOBBET
  
I rollen kommer du att ingå i en special grupp NOC / DecOps3 för att hantera (stor koncern) och arbeta med förändring i alla aspekter av en modern datormiljö, inklusive servrar, lagring, nätverk och stödsystem i en hybrid moln IT-miljö. Detta inkluderar även slutanvändardatorer, SaaS-molntjänster, Identity Access Management, Cyber Security, leverantörs- och leverantörsengagemang, inköp och Enterprise Mobility Management. Du kommer i bred regi att designa, övervaka och utföra uppgraderingar, nyinstallationer, integrationsuppgifter, driftuppgifter och felsökning av levererade IT-system och tjänster i Dev-, Test- och Produktionsmiljöer.
  
ARBETSUPPGIFTER
  
Leverera enligt IT Service Delivery Management och IT Operations life cycle
  
Delta i Incident- , Problem- och Change Management
  
Hjälp till att automatisera och effektivisera verksamhet och processer
  
Utveckla och underhålla skript för automatisering och övervakning
  
Arbeta med hybrid- och molninfrastruktur som allmänna datortjänster, VPC, PKI-hantering, nätverk, lagringstjänster, säkerhetssystem, kommunikationssystem och backup
  
Proaktivt underhålla och övervaka levererade IT-system och relaterade tjänster
  
Se till att servrar och relaterade utrustningar är uppdaterade med patchhantering, anti-malware och andra hotskydd
  
Arbeta med egna 5G nätet
  
Samarbeta med IT-operations kollegor, utvecklings- och serviceleveransteam för att säkerställa att tjänster är tillgängliga 24 x 7 x 365
  
Arbetar nära med NOC och SOC som en eskaleringsnivå för kundsupport och för operativa produktionsfall
  
Stöd lokala- och fjärranvändare över hela världen
  
Hantera Public Clouds-konton som är infrastrukturen för företagets levererade tjänster, integrationerna till tredjeparts- och SaaS-molntjänster
  
Hantera, logga och åtgärda uppkomna driftstörningar
  
Löpande arbete med prestandaoptimering
  
Löpande dokumentation av system och ITSM-processer
  
Samverka med hårdvaru- och mjukvaruleverantörer vid behov
  
Se till att verksamhetens (kundens) förväntningar uppfylls eller överträffas
  
Möta och uppfylla satta mål för rollen
  
Arbeta med säkerhetskopiering och återställning
  
Ingå i daglig IT-operations samt projekt
  
Verka som mentor åt juniora medarbetare
  
Följa policyer, rutiner och rutiner
  
  

**Skall krav:**  

Minst 6 års erfarenhet av IT-operations / NOC /SOC /CSIRT /
  
Van med hybrid-infrastruktur mellan on-prem och cloud
  
O365 administration (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive etc)
  
Vana av att arbeta med anti-malware och hotskyddstjänster
  
Stor vana av AD, Azure AD, Entra-ID
  
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Identity Access Management och SSO
  
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Enterprise Mobility och Device Management
  
Microsoft Azure-tjänster
  
Microsoft SQL Server
  
Övervakningssystem
  
Programmering
  
Scripting/Powershell
  
SNMP
  
Event Management
  
Incident Management
  
Windows Server
  
Linux
  
VMware
  
Nätverk, switchar, brandväggar
  
Kunskap i mobiltnät, dect & telefoniväxlar
  
Automatisering med Powershell
  
Arbeta metodiskt efter modern ITSM standard
  
Van att arbeta med Windows Server, virtualisering. PC, MAC, iOS, Andoid enheter
  
Kunskap i Svenska och Engelska
  
  

**Meriterande kompetens:**  

PowerApps och PowerAutomate
  
Cloud tjänster som AWS och GCP
  
Cisco Meraki
  
Fortigate
  
ServiceNow
  
Azure DevOps
  
Logistik
  
Hälso & Sjukvård
  
  

Som anställd på Vajbi AB kommer en obligatorisk säkerhetskontroll att krävas. (Då vi jobbar mycket med säkerhetsklassade uppdrag)
  
För att ligga steget före om du skulle bli anställd som underleverantör, beställ ett utdrag till ditt brottsregister via följande länk. Kuvertet måste vara oöppnat.
  
Det kommer inte att krävas förrän vi har initierat ett eventuellt avtal med dig. https://polisen.se/tjanster-tillstand/belastningsregistret/kontrollera-dina-uppgifter-i-belastningsregistret/
  
Vi värdesätter din drivkraft att lära och utvecklas mer än din erfarenhet av specifika system och verktyg.
  
Välkommen att fortsätta din utvecklingsresa med oss på Vajbi AB!

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
**World leader in engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering combines its broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software to support the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Coupled with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 55,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including Aeronautics, Space, Defense, Naval, Automotive, Rail, Infrastructure & Transportation, Energy, Utilities & Chemicals, Life Sciences, Communications, Semiconductor & Electronics, Industrial & Consumer, Software & Internet.**

**Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of Capgemini, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 360,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2022 global revenues of €22 billion.**

**DevSecOps Engineer**
----------------------

**We offer our clients development services and need to strengthen our team with skilled DevSecOps Engineers. You will be an important and central part of our global team and responsible for implementations and goals in our projects.**

**Responsibilities in the role include control repositories, container registries, and the CI/CD pipelines including debugging of failures, application programming, and making sure security standards are kept. It also includes interface (API) management, and creation of new routes within the API gateway, orchestration, release automation, and operational management, and monitoring observability.**

**As a DevSecOps Engineer you will create standards for deployment, monitoring, and logging, and design and implement automation for common operational tasks, wherever possible. The role also includes supporting the development teams with needs regarding the foundation services and guiding them on how to effectively move to a container-based platform.**

**This is a permanent position based in Gothenburg, Sweden.**

**Your profile**

* **MSc or Bachelor of Computer Science**
* **7+ years of industry experience, whereof a minimum of 3 years as a DevSecOps Engineer**
* **At least 3 years of experience working with Containers Orchestration (Kubernetes or Openshift)**
* **Experiences from CI/CD tools like Jenkins, VSTS, or Azure DevOps**
* **Experience from any cloud provider, Azure, GCP, or AWS - certification is a plus**
* **At least 3 years of experience in Source control like Git, VSTS, or similar**
* **Proficiency in at least one high-level scripting language (e.g. Python, Powershell)**
* **Understanding of protocols/technologies like HTTP, SSL, LDAP, SSH, etc.**
* **Experience from monitoring tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, or similar**
* **Any experience in Infrastructure Automation like IAC and Terraform is a plus.**
**What we offer**
-----------------

**Capgemini Engineering is one of the world's leading consulting companies in R&D. We work in most industries globally. In Scandinavia, we focus mainly on Automotive, Manufacturing, Telecom and Life Science. We deliver, together with our global centers of expertise, solutions for both large global customers and smaller local start-up companies. title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Sebratec exists to help industries solve technology-based tasks and accomplish complex projects. We offer real intelligence in the form of highly skilled engineers and developers to make projects come alive and thrive. If you share our passion for great technology, then we’d love to get to know you.

### **Let's Work Together**


Are you a skilled DevOps Engineer with expertise in infrastructure management, automation, and cloud technologies? Do you thrive in an environment that challenges your technical prowess and encourages continuous learning? If so, Sebratec might be the perfect place for you.

#### **Your Role**


As a DevOps Engineer at Sebratec, you will:

* **Design, implement, and manage** infrastructure for scalable and reliable applications.
* **Automate workflows and processes** using scripting languages like Python and Bash.
* **Monitor, maintain, and optimize** Linux-based systems.
* **Deploy and manage applications** on cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* **Collaborate with development teams** to streamline CI/CD pipelines and improve deployment processes.
* **Ensure system security and compliance** with industry standards.

### **Technical Requirements**


To succeed in this role, you should have:

* Proven experience in **infrastructure management** and **DevOps practices**.
* Proficiency in **Python** and **Bash** scripting.
* Strong knowledge of **Linux** operating systems.
* Experience with **cloud providers** (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Familiarity with **CI/CD tools** (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI).
* Knowledge of **containerization technologies** (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Understanding of **infrastructure as code (IaC)** tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible).
* Strong **problem-solving skills** and **attention to detail**.
* Excellent **communication and collaboration skills**

### **W****hat you can expect from Sebratec**

* Fixed monthly salary, so you’re covered even if you’re between projects
* Pension, regulations and insurances that play by the book (the collective agreement book, that is)
* Monthly events and get-togethers
* Career development and opportunities at industry-leading partners.
* Great benefits that keep your work-life balance in check
* Generous extension- and referral bonus programs

### **Office Tour**


Take a tour of our Gothenburg HQ on the West Coast of Sweden and you’ll see why Sebratecers from across the globe have decided to call it home.

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
***Vill du vara med och göra skillnad för framtidens DevSecOps-lösningar tillsammans med Capgemini? Vill du arbeta med nya tekniker, Cloud, AI, Big Data och skapa en säker, effektiv och automatiserad framtid? Välkommen till Capgemini!***

  

**OM ROLLEN**  

**Vi hjälper dagligen företag och miljoner användare att få en trevligare upplevelse och tillsammans skapa en bättre framtid.**

**Hos oss på Capgemini arbetar vi för att få framtiden du vill – här får du riktigt trevliga kollegor, många sociala aktiviteter, konkurrensmässig lön, stora möjligheter för karriär, massor av förmåner, energigivande arbete och mycket möjligheter för vidareutbildning.**

**Som DevSecOps Engineer på Capgemini kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare när det gäller att automatisera mjukvaruprojekt i molnet med CI/CD och säkerhet. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med och lära dig nya spännande tekniker som tex: AWS, GCP, Azure, AlicCloud, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, Databricks, AI, Data Engineering, AIOps, BlackDuck, SonarCube, Vertex AI, GHAS, Terraform och OpenAI.**

  

**DIN PROFIL**

* **Minst 3 års erfarenhet i en DevOps, AIOps, dataingenjör eller molningenjörs-roll**
* **Erfarenhet av: Terraform**
* **Erfarenhet av: GitHub Actions**
* **Erfarenhet av: Cloud (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure eller AliCloud)**
* **Kunskap i svenska och engelska obehindrat i språk och skrift**

  

**ANSÖKAN**  

**Vi rekryterar löpande till denna roll, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Från att vi kontaktar dig tar processen cirka 2-3 veckor då vi i största möjliga mån arbetar agilt i rekryteringsprocessen, vilket innebär att flera steg kan ske parallellt.**

**OM CAPGEMINI**  

**Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda deras övergång till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2023 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,5 miljarder euro.**  

**Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Jobbeskrivning


Vi förstärker just nu vårt Stockholmsteam och söker en DevOps Engineer. Stockholmskontoret har ett brett spektrum av interna projekt för att utveckla produkter inom flera olika verksamheter. Detta inkluderar både nationella och internationella kunder som vi levererar storskaliga åtaganden till.


Som DevOps Engineer och konsult hos oss ingår du i CI/CD-teamet inom sektionen DevOps Platform. Teamets uppdrag är att hjälpa olika befintliga och nya projekt att sätta upp sin infrastruktur baserat på projektspecifika behov.


Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får möjlighet att arbeta med olika projekt/tekniska lösningar, utforska, designa och bygga arkitektur för olika typer av applikationer hos olika kunder.


Matchar din profil nedan beskrivning?


Kvalifikationer


Vi söker någon med nedanstående kunskaper och erfarenheter, men vi tror dock att du kan vara en intressant kandidat även om du inte uppfyller alla kriterier.

* Flera års praktisk erfarenhet av Linux-hantering och skriptning
* Några års praktisk erfarenhet av Azure DevOps (infra) relaterade tjänster.
* God erfarenhet av shellskript, Makefiles, YAML, och helst andra programmeringsspråk
* Erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla CI/CD-miljöer
* Erfarenheter av att designa, implementera och hantera CI/CD-pipelines på Gitlab, GitHub, Jenkins och Azure
* Erfarenhet av containers och molntekniker (t.ex. Docker, Kubernetes, AWS)
* Applikationsdistributionsarkitektur via Docker och TLS-certifikatshantering för produktionsmiljöer
* Arkitekturkunskap om frontend-teknologier som Angular/React, backend-teknologier som .NET Core/C#/Java samt databaser och meddelandelösningar
* Erfarenhet av felsökning, t.ex. brandväggsinställningar, serverproblem, trafik mellan servrar
* God förståelse för DNS, routing, lastbalansering, nätverk och brandväggsteknik
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


Vi lägger även stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper som vi tror bland annat kännetecknas av att du är en Team player som tycker om att ta ansvar, kan arbeta självständigt och har ett öga för detaljer.


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!  

  

Obs! Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-08-12. *På grund av semesterperioden kommer ansökningarna och eventuella frågor att hanteras från och med vecka 32. Vi önskar dig en härlig sommar!*


Företagsbeskrivning


AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.


Ytterligare information


Vad erbjuder AFRY dig som anställd?


Vi har regelbundna träffar där temat varierar mellan kompetens och socialt utbyte, eller både och. En bra balans helt enkelt!


Du får du t.ex.:

* En AFRY Buddy som bollplank under din första tid som anställd
* Vi arbetar aktivt med vår strategi för löpande utveckling för våra konsulter. Detta sker genom kompetensutvecklingsprojekt, seminarier, utbildningar, samarbeten etc.
* Balans i arbetslivet med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
* Tillgång till Club AFRY där en bredd av spännande och underhållande aktiviteter för våra medarbetare anordnas - det finns något för alla! Läs gärna mer här.
* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner gällande pension, friskvård och föräldraledighet reglerade i vårt kollektivavtal
* Företagsrabatter med externa partners genom vår förmånsportal Advantage You.
* Friskvårdsbidrag 3000 SEK/år.
* Restauranger och kaféer på plats
* Ett enormt nätverk av tekniska experter med +19 000 kollegor runtom i världen.


Kontaktpersoner för frågor:


Aamir Faried, rekryterande chef  

Aamir.faried@afry.com


Rebecka Gravås, rekryteringspartner  

rebecka.gravas@afry.com


Om rekryteringsprocessen :


I alla våra rekryteringsprocesser använder vi oss av kompetensbaserad rekrytering - för en rättvis och träffsäker rekrytering.

* Telefonavstämning eller urvalsfrågor via mejl
* Två intervjusteg (IRL eller via Teams)
* Referenstagning
* Erbjudande

*Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.*

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*


Apply information


Position


DevOps Engineer
Location


Solna
Country


Sweden
Reference number


REF9769K

title: Senior Cloud Platform Specialist
description:
###### **Solna**


**Senior Cloud Platform Specialist to Swedish Space Corporation**



Are there clouds in space? Do you like new technology and the opportunity to help influence and develop the future? Then maybe the role of Senior Cloud Specialist at SSC is something for you!



SSC is now looking for a Senior Cloud Platform Specialist to join the global IT team. You are offered a challenging role in an exciting industry where you get a technical, hands-on role combined with Architectural design.



At the Swedish Space Corporation (SSC), we are pioneering the future of space services and technology. Established in 1972, SSC provides comprehensive satellite communication, launch services, and cutting-edge space research from our globally recognized facilities, including the Esrange Space Center. Whether it's advancing scientific knowledge, supporting commercial satellite operations, or enhancing national security, SSC is your trusted partner in navigating the final frontier.



Join us in pushing the boundaries of innovation and “Help Earth benefit from Space”!


**YOUR ROLE**



The Senior Cloud Platform Specialist is a technical, hands-on role, with architectural responsibility, who is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing cloud-based infrastructure to ensure optimal performance, scalability, and security.


* Develop and implement cloud architecture that meet business requirements and optimize performance.
* Oversee the deployment, management, and maintenance of cloud infrastructure.
* Ensure cloud solutions comply with security standards and regulatory requirements, implementing robust security measures.
* Monitor and manage cloud costs, optimizing resource usage to achieve cost-efficiency.
* Provide advanced troubleshooting and technical support for cloud-related issues, ensuring minimal downtime.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of cloud architecture, configurations, and procedures.
* Stay updated with the latest cloud technologies and best practices, recommending and implementing improvements.
* You will not only advance your expertise in cloud technologies but also take on the rewarding responsibility of mentoring and training colleagues across the organization.
* Your insights and knowledge will help elevate our team's overall proficiency, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.
* Internal: Collaborate with IT teams, development teams, project managers, and business stakeholders.
* External: Work with cloud service providers, vendors, and consultants to implement and manage cloud solutions.

  


**WHO YOU ARE**


**Personal Characteristics**


* Ability to analyze complex problems and develop effective solutions.
* High level of accuracy and attention to detail in architectural design and implementation.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, in Swedish and English, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
* Flexibility to adapt to changing technologies and business needs.


**Knowledge**

* Minimum 3+ years of proven experience as a Cloud Platform Specialist or similar role in a high-tech industry.
* Architectural Skills, Strong understanding of cloud architecture principles. Deep expertise in cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure.
* Strong understanding of cloud security principles, identity management and compliance.
* Experience with infrastructure-as-code.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for continuous learning and improvement.
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a diverse and global team.
* DevOps, Knowledge of DevOps tools and methodologies, including CI/CD pipelines.
* Networking, good understanding of networking concepts and technologies related to cloud environments.
* Scripting and Automation, Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell) and automation tools.


**Nice to haves:**


* Certifications in cloud technology on Solution Architect level or higher
* Knowledge of legacy concepts and migration paths
* Experience from working closely with software- developers and engineers.

  


**WE OFFER YOU**


* A great opportunity for professional development and advancement.
* An international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.
* Access to leading online learning platform for tech professionals.
* Attractive occupational pension (ITP) and tax exchange for pension.
* Wellness grant of 5,000 SEK/year
* In addition to 30 days’ vacation and traditional holidays, we have extra days off.
* To be part of creating the future of the Swedish and global space industry.


 **Work Conditions**

* Environment: Office-based with the possibility of remote work.
* Travel: Occasional travel may be required for meetings, training, or conferences.
* Working Hours: Full-time position with standard working hours

  


**Swedish Citizenship is a requirement.**


**We are accepting applicants until 12th of August and applications will be reviewed after this date.**

  


**LOCATION**



Solna Strand, Stockholm

  


**NEXT STEP**



Are you interested in this challenging position within an international work environment in a successful company? Apply now! We evaluate all applications continuously. Please apply using your CV and personal letter by clicking the apply button below.



The position requires a background control and security interview before employment.

description:

title: Cloud Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**World leader in engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering combines its broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software to support the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Coupled with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 55,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including Aeronautics, Space, Defense, Naval, Automotive, Rail, Infrastructure & Transportation, Energy, Utilities & Chemicals, Life Sciences, Communications, Semiconductor & Electronics, Industrial & Consumer, Software & Internet.**

**Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of Capgemini, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 360,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2022 global revenues of €22 billion.**

* **Implement Application using Microsoft/Amazon best practices**
* **Very good communication skills in English. Any Nordic language is advantageous**
* **Familiar with agile way of working and a team player**
* **Valid work permit for Sweden**

**Nice to have skills:**

* **Certified as Azure/AWS Associate Eg Security and Networking**
* **FinOps Certified**
* **Terraform certified.**

Today we are part of the Capgemini Group, which gives us even more opportunities to find the right clients and projects. Based on the clients' needs, we provide expert competence, entire project groups, services and overall commitments. Always based on what best suits the client’s own organization and challenges.**

title: Salesforce CTO - Nordics
description:
Are you ready to make a real impact? Join our Nordic Salesforce Center of Excellence (COE) as our Salesforce CTO!


As part of one of the top 5 global Salesforce partners, you will play a crucial role in shaping our Nordic market and clients while being part of our global Salesforce community and CTO Network. This position offers an exceptional opportunity to collaborate and exchange knowledge with a fast-growing community of Salesforce experts. To grow and further strengthen our organization, we are looking for a qualified Salesforce CTO to engage as lead architect in complex multi-cloud, enterprise-scale transformations and sales pursuits.


As the Salesforce CTO for the Nordics, you will use your vast experience and expertise to make an impact across these areas:


* **Business Growth:** Build winning proposals and offers backed by innovative solutions, modern delivery approaches, and competitive estimations. Guide CxOs in their decision process to select Salesforce technology and/or Capgemini as their trusted transformation partner within Digital Customer Experience (DCX).
* **Delivery Quality Assurance:** Shape and participate in design authority and advisory roles across strategic Nordic Salesforce engagements to oversee the realization of proposed target and transition architectures, ensuring long-term scalable and cost-efficient solutions that meet the business objectives of our clients. In this aspect you will also manage own chargeability of 50%.
* **Curate and Deploy Salesforce Assets and Accelerators:** Promote and position Capgemini’s global offers and accelerators, adapting assets for deployment in the local market or customer context.
* **Provide Thought Leadership and Community Building:** Mentor, activate, and grow the Salesforce architect community within Capgemini Nordics, nurturing future CX architects.
**We see the following experiences and skills as meriting:**
------------------------------------------------------------

* **Expertise in Solution Selling:** Proven track record in crafting innovative and scalable solutions within the CX and CRM domain, developing winning proposals, leading bid submissions, and presenting pitches effectively while managing risk related to the sales process.
* **C-Suite Engagement:** Comfortable driving discussions at the c-suite level, managing objections, and defending your position. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with executive-level presentation and facilitation experience.
* **Enterprise Architecture and Delivery Experience:** Extensive experience in leading or working within an enterprise architecture function at the intersection of business and technology, focusing on capabilities in Customer Experience (Sales, Service, Marketing, Commerce, Analytics, and beyond). Functional and technical knowledge of CRM domains and solutions. Experience working in large-scale, national/international transformation initiatives with complex, multi-vendor, multi-stakeholder, and multi-country delivery structures.
* **Integration Expertise:** Experience from designing internal and/or external integrations with the Salesforce platform; experience with Mulesoft integration framework is a plus.
* **Governance and Risk Management** : Skilled in implementing architectural governance, managing issues and risks related to the realization of target architecture.
* **People Leadership, Mentorship, and Talent Development:** Proven track record of leading and mentoring other architects and technical teams in global organizations.
* **Industry Relevance:** Deep understanding of industries such as Telco, Energy, Public Sector, Automotive, and Manufacturing.
* **Multi-Vendor Solutions Knowledge** : Understanding of competitive and complementary technologies to Salesforce, with the ability to evaluate pros and cons and defend Salesforce’s value proposition.
* **Strategic Partnerships:** Strong relationships within key strategic partner ecosystems, including partners, vendors, and experts, with an active network.
* **IT and Salesforce Experience:** 10+ years of overall IT experience with 5+ years of experience on Salesforce technology related to multi-cloud architecture and the entire delivery lifecycle.
* **Salesforce Certification: Salesforce:** Technical Architecture certification or ambition to achieve it in the near future.
* **Hands-On Development and Problem-Solving:** Hands-on development and configuration background with a consultancy approach to problem-solving. Expertise in Development Life Cycle and DevOps applied to the Salesforce platform.
* **Language Skills:** Fluent in English and a Nordic language.

title: Azure Data Architect
description:
**Insights & data is a global business line within Capgemini, comprising 27,000 experts. Our focus? Creating reliable, scalable data platforms with cutting-edge technology. From Gen-AI to business intelligence, we cover it all. Join us in transforming industries through end-to-end Data & AI solutions. We work across industries and have a collaborative environment, where your unique perspective matters.**  

  

**YOUR ROLE**  

**Are you passionate about shaping data-driven solutions for clients in different industries? Want to be part of a strong community of 10 000 Architects globally?**  

  

**Capgemini has partnership with Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Databricks and Snowflake. Although we believe that your expertise lies within Azure services, as an Architect within our organization, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a variety of services, such as Microsoft Azure/Fabric, Snowflake, Databricks, AWS or GCP. On top of that, you’ll be provided with a lot of opportunities to collaborate with other Architects in Sweden as well as across the Nordics.**  

  

**What You’ll Do:**

* **Drive innovation and change** **: Actively engage with the partner ecosystem to generate market presence and create opportunities.**
* **Design** **: Shape and own the end-to- end solution to ensure overall data quality, evolutionary architectures, security, and maintainability and performance.**
* **Collaborate** **: Work closely with stakeholders, developers, and analysts to understand business needs. Providing leadership and direction to the technical teams and being a partner to the engagement manager and jointly own the delivery.**
* **Implement** **: Translate requirements into practical solutions, ensuring data quality, security, and performance.**
* **Guide** **: Mentor junior team members and share best practices.**
**YOUR PROFILE**

* **7+ years of working within data & analytics as a Lead Data Engineer or Architect.**
* **Data Modeling: Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing.**
* **Practical work experience in Azure services; networks, storage, data and analytics services, security and databases (Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, Databricks, etc.).**
* **Experience in architecting and designing data solutions using trade-off analysis.**
* **Knowledge of different information architecture patterns (e.g., dimensional model, data vault 2.0, data mesh, lakehouse).**
* **Familiarity with DevOps tools, including version control (Git) and CI/CD pipelines.**
* **Experienced in architecture governance and documentation.**
* **Experienced in data management, data security, and access control in the cloud.**
* **Prototyping mindset and familiarity with Python and SQL.**
* **Problem Solver: Analytical mindset to tackle complex challenges.**
* **We welcome both English and Swedish speaking candidates that are currently located in Sweden.**

  

**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE**  

**We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.**  

**At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.**  

**Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as Databricks and Microsoft Azure.**  

  

**APPLICATION**  

**Ready to join our team? Apply Now!**  

  

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**  

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**  

  

**Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**

title: Förvaltningsansvarig inom DEV/OPS operations
description:
*Vi på Länsförsäkringar AB söker en engagerad och kommunikativ person med erfarenhet inom IT förvaltning och god teknisk förståelse. Som Förvaltningsansvarig inom DevOps Operations Motor kommer du att vara en viktig del av vårt team och ansvara för att analysera och hantera incidenter, bygga relationer samt bidra till att lösa problemärenden. Vi utökar nu vårt ansvarsområde med ett antal applikationer inom Motorskador och vi letar därför efter en ny kollega.*  


**Om jobbet**
Vi söker en ny kollega som ska ansvara för de Skadeapplikationer som vi utökar vårt ansvarsområde med. Som ansvarig för Skadeapplikationer kommer du att ha följande arbetsuppgifter:
* Analysera, hantera och kommunicera incidenter och driftstörningar.
* Leda problemärenden i samarbete med resurser från tågets team.
* Utföra inkomna beställningar, agera som användarstöd och ge tekniskt användarstöd till handläggare och super-users.
* Bygga och vidmakthålla relationer med verksamhet, leverantörer och andra förvaltningsgrupperingar inom Länsförsäkringar.
* Utföra och skapa kontrollbevis för revisionskontroller samt utföra generella IT-kontroller.
* Utveckla metoder för incident- och problemhantering inom den lean agila setupen tillsammans med teamet samt bidra till gruppens fortsatta välmående och utveckling.
* Du kommer i första hand ta över ansvaret för våra Skadeapplikationer och på sikt arbeta även inom andra områden.
* Du kommer att arbeta i en gruppering med ytterligare tre förvaltningsansvariga i ett nära samarbete.

  


**Vem är du?**
För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll önskar vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:
* Erfarenhet inom IT förvaltning med en bakgrund som tekniker eller utvecklare inom en Windowsmiljö.
* God förståelse för teknisk infrastruktur.
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.


Meriterande kvalifikationer:
* Erfarenhet av att leda incident, problemärenden och erfarenhet av operations/förvaltning inom SAFe.
* Grundläggande kunskaper om Stordator och Stordatorappliaktioner.
* Utbildning inom ITIL.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera incidenter i större förvaltningsobjekt med flera komplexa system och erfarenhet av att jobba inom en verksamhet med outsourcing.
* Erfarenhet av SQL och .NET i tekniska eller utvecklande roller.
* Domänkunskap inom försäkring och bank samt en akademisk IT-bakgrund.

  


Som person är du serviceminded och lösningsorienterad. Du tar ansvar för dina uppgifter och har förmågan att bygga relationer med andra. Du är prestigelös och trivs med att ha många olika typer av arbetsuppgifter.  


Rekryterande chef för denna roll är på semester över sommaren och är åter på arbetet 5 augusti och du kommer därför inte få någon återkoppling innan dess.  


**Om oss**
Affärsenhet SAK inom Länsförsäkringar AB ansvarar för service och utveckling av länsförsäkringsgruppens sakförsäkringsaffär. Inom Motorområdet arbetar man i en miljö som består av både anställda medarbetare och konsulter. En del av leveranserna hanteras av externa leverantörer. Vi är ett team som samarbetar och ställer upp för varandra - i positiv anda. Ansök nu och bli en del av vårt team!  


**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande?* *Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*  


**Sista ansökningsdag:** **2024-08-05**
  
Kort om tjänsten


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare
**Arbetsplats:** Stockholm
**Chef:** Maria Wendin
**Kontaktuppgifter:** Maria.Wendin@lansforsakringar.se
Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?


Bli en del av något större och börja jobba hos oss. En karriär hos Länsförsäkringar handlar lika mycket om att vara en hjälpande hand för våra kunder genom alla livets skeenden som att stärka lokalsamhället där du verkar.

title: Technical Architect - Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
description:
***Are you an experienced AEM Architect interested in working with Customer Experience Management in the latest technologies? Are you interested in working with specialist from around the world?***  

  

**About the role**  

  

We at Capgemini are leaders in Adobe-based solutions for Customer Experience Management and are now looking for committed and experienced people to join us on our continued journey! Our digital team is growing and now you will have the opportunity to develop your skills together with your colleagues. Our customers are in various stages of a digital transformation where you, as a new joiner within the Digital Marketing team at Capgemini Sweden, will have the opportunity to use and develop your expertise and leadership within Adobe Experience Manager. In this role you will have the opportunity to deliver to some of the biggest global brands, work with clients and other third parties as well as teams within Capgemini. We are looking for committed people, with a willingness to learn and want to be part of a great development journey!
  

  

**Key responsibilities:**  



* Design and implementation of Technical Solution based on AEM, specific customer business, strategic and technical requirements.
* Define customer strategies and requirements in project phases and implementation roadmap based on client priorities and requirements and technical dependencies.
* Lead workshops and guide customer in how to optimize production, management and delivery of content in various digital channels.
* Technical discussions with customers in various industries regarding Digital Content Management, MarTech solutions, integration with existing systems and target architecture.
* Proactively propose and implement solutions for process improvement.
* Design and lead the integration of Adobe Experience Manager both within the Adobe ecosystem and with other tools that our customers have.
Develop code and configuration. Lead the development team with best practices for development within AEM.  
* 

  

Within the scope of the role, there is also an opportunity for you - if there is an interest - to shape more strategic sales and marketing activities, where you become a leader in our Adobe community in Sweden (guild) and work closely with our Adobe CoE (Center of Excellence) in pre-sales and sales work.  

  



**Your profile:**  



* +5 years of experience in web application development, DevOps tools and coding best practices such as CI/CD, GIT, Test Frameworks
* +3 years of experience as Technical Architect implementing applications with Adobe Experience Manager – AEM.
* Knowledge of web technologies such as: HTML5, Java Script, XML, Java, WCM, OSGi, REST, GraphQL, Web Analytics, Single Page Application.
* You have a problem-solving attitude. Identify and solve problems and give advice to others, or if needed call in other experts. You can collaborate effectively with your team as well as with the customer.
* To stand out Swedish in oral and written is a big plus.

title: Automation Test QA Engineer
description:
Are you interested in using your Automation Test development & QA skills for something that has a real impact? Develop automation suites & testing systems for a complex system with modern tooling? **Be a part of redesigning how B2B E-commerce and Procurement SaaS work**? If so, then we want to learn more about you!



Droppe is a Source-to-Order platform. Droppe’s platform offers businesses an easy way to source, order and manage supplies, such as safety, paper, workwear and packaging supplies for their operations.



Since 2020, Droppe has served 1500+ industrial buyers across Europe and scaled to over 150+ leading European brands.



As a **Automation Test Engineer,** you will be working together with the development team and our Principal QA Engineer on test automation development-related tasks. The goals of this position is to move us towards faster release cycles, scale the efforts of our manual QA for faster QA checks, and cover the basis on our complex 2-sided marketplace with auxiliary customer-facing products as well as internal tools. You should be passionate about building robust test suites spanning interfaces, integrations, analytics, databases, ETL pipelines, and auxiliary applications.



**We are seeking a self-starter that:**


* Is energetic; empathic and cares about intuitive user interfaces and user experience and doesn't compromise on quality
* Result-driven & resilient; ability to excel in a rapidly changing environment and keep track of and understand complex systems
* Good listener. The ability to understand the needs and reasons of different stakeholders—and structure own work proactively accordingly
* Fast-learner. Ability to pick up new tooling as well as understand the other aspects of Droppe’s operations & core business
* Enjoy fast-paced teams where the initiative and accountability do generate results every day
* Loves to develop with modern tooling, automate things, challenge the status-quo & continuously improve processes

**Required skills & proof of success:**


* Exceptionally strong experience with end-to-end (E2E) testing and unit testing, backend integration testing, backend unit testing
* Interest & background in visual regression testing and building metrics for non-functional defects
* Some prior experience in more holistic testing of SEO regressions, and testing GA4 / GTM related data layer interactions in an automated fashion
* Has some experience in Typescript, PHP/Laravel
* Deeper understanding of React and especially NextJS with its different underlying structures such as SSG & SSR is considered a strong plus
* Solid knowledge of relational databases and database design, ETL pipeline exposure is considered a plus
* Experience with consuming RESTful or GraphQl APIs
* Proficient at Git (we use Git Flow with GitHub)
* **Minimum 2 years** in writing automation tests in the areas outlined above

Our stack consists of Docker, headless Laravel based backend, and PostgreSQL. Next.js, Typescript, Less & Jest for frontend. We’re running on AWS & deployments are automated with CircleCI. And use Cypress for E2E testing. For data we use fivetran, DBT and BigQuery.



**What we offer:**


* Modern tooling & peer-learning on full-stack & DevOps development
* Full transparency into how a SaaS enabled marketplace company & B2B sales organization is run, how software development can support B2B commerce directly, and see how fast a young startup can move in a traditional industry
* Competitive salary & optional equity
* Mission-driven and unrivaled environment for driven personalities
* Caring meritocracy to support high performance
* Steep learning curve in software development and significant personal growth
* Flexible work hours and location (remote)

The position will report to Shaheer (Principal QA Engineer) and indirectly to Henrik (Co-founder, Tech & Growth) and will be a part of the Scrum Dev team.



**To apply to the Droppe team,** please send a brief introduction, a link to your Linkedin profile, and a link to your portfolio and/or Github.



We enthusiastically look forward to hearing from you!


  
Droppe
Ruotsi
Kokopäiväinen
Julkaistu 26.06.2024

title: Senior Prestandatestare – Stockholm deltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en senior prestandatestare. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 50-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag. Du ska ansvara för att utforma och genomföra prestandatester.
  
  

**Du har:**  

Utbildning på kandidatnivå
  
Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom utveckling (som JavaScript, Python, C#/.Net, Java)
  
Enhetstestning (som JUnit, XUnit)
  
Förståelse för teststrategier
  
Förståelse för agila arbetssätt
  
Prestandatest
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Testautomationsverktyg (som Selenium, Cypress, Katalon, Postman, Soap-UI, pytest)
  
CI/CD-verktyg (som Azure DevOps, Gitlab, Jenkins)
  
ISTQB-certifiering
  
Versionshantering (som Git)
  
Kunskap inom mordern infrastruktur med containers/mikrotjänster (som kubernetesplattformar)
  
  

**Du får:**  

Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant
  
Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där certifieringar är en självklarhet
  
Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak
  
Åka på spännande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter
  
Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionsersättning, ett ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och andra generösa förmåner
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Deltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Senior Prestandatestare – Stockholm deltid” i ärenderaden.

title: DevOps Engineer (Kafka)
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Event and Integration Services team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer with a strong focus on working with Kafka. In this role, you will engage with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem, collaborating with a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You will see the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas. Partnering with different teams and areas, you will support our Unit in driving the Integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. You will build and configure Kafka solutions that are easy to maintain and adapt, regardless of tools or languages. Believing in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust, you will work with a focus on value creation, growth, and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Join our high-performance team and constantly improve the experience of our end users.
   

  

 Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Strong experience in software engineering with focus on event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Solace.
* Worked with Event-driven Architecture and knowledge of how to implement this on a large scale in an Enterprise.
* Deep understanding of CI/CD automation for platform onboarding and self-service capabilities
* Deep knowledge of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Develop and maintain event-driven architecture using platforms like Solace and Kafka.
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
* Deep understanding of Event-Driven Architecture principles.
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Extensive hands-on experience with event platforms such as Solace and Kafka.
* Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, or similar).
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid.
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30th of June. We will review and interview applicants on-going. If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Hranda Khrystyna at khrystyna.hranda@hm.com

title: DevOps Engineer with Event-Driven Architecture Expertise
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Event and Integration Services team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer with a strong focus on working with Kafka. In this role, you will engage with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem, collaborating with a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You will see the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas. Partnering with different teams and areas, you will support our Unit in driving the Integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. You will build and configure Kafka solutions that are easy to maintain and adapt, regardless of tools or languages. Believing in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust, you will work with a focus on value creation, growth, and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Join our high-performance team and constantly improve the experience of our end users.
   

  

 Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Strong experience in software engineering with focus on event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Solace.
* Worked with Event-driven Architecture and knowledge of how to implement this on a large scale in an Enterprise.
* Deep understanding of CI/CD automation for platform onboarding and self-service capabilities
* Deep knowledge of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Develop and maintain event-driven architecture using platforms like Solace and Kafka.
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
* Deep understanding of Event-Driven Architecture principles.
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Extensive hands-on experience with event platforms such as Solace and Kafka.
* Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, or similar).
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid.
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30th of June. We will review and interview applicants on-going. If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Hranda Khrystyna at khrystyna.hranda@hm.com

title: DevOps Engineer (Azure DevOps/C#) - API Platform
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Job Description**
 If building and maintaining technology platforms excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The API Platform team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer who will play a critical role in designing, implementing and maintaining the deployments and integration processes for H&Ms API platform. The platform enables our product teams around the world to deploy software solutions that run independently. You will be part of a high-performance team that constantly aims to improve the experience of our end users and you. In this role, you will also be partnering with teams and areas to support our unit in driving the integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap.
   

  

 Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Work on ways to automate and improve development and release processes
* Identify technical problems in the pipelines, implement software updates and fixes
* Evaluate, build and implement new development tools and infrastructure
* Ensure systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
* Deliver on time, demonstrating strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Align on CI/CD guidelines/guardrails with our Developer Experience Unit
* Drive refactoring of legacy systems, to help enable decoupling and modernize the software architecture
* Build the simplest possible solution that fulfils functional and quality requirements
* Actively apply best practices within CI/CD
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation
* Work with software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years IT experience with at least 6 years working with Cloud technologies (Azure, GCP)
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementing and managing Azure DevOps pipelines and YAML-based pipeline configurations
* Hands-on with languages & tools relevant to CI/CD Pipeline implementation e.g. .NET, C#, PowerShell, Bash etc.
* Good expertise and experience with DevOps services administration, monitoring and troubleshooting of pipelines
* Hands-on with managing and troubleshooting coupled integrations for SCM, Key Vaults, Logging and alert systems etc.
* Experience leveraging IaC (Infrastructure as Code) for deployment automation using Terraform, ARM template etc. on Microsoft Azure & Google Cloud Platform
* In-depth experience with API management platform (Azure preferred)
* Hands-on experience with Azure CLI and/or PowerShell & REST API
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Experience with industry best practices, strategies and troubleshooting for integration, build and deploy capabilities.
* Knowledge and experience in deployment using GitHub actions is highly desirable
* Knowledge and experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is meriting
* Preferred to have at least Azure Administrator (AZ104) and/or Developer (AZ204) certifications
* Azure Solution Architect (AZ305) and/or DevOps Engineer (AZ400) are strong plus!
* Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker and Kubernetes) is meriting
* Ability to design, document and clearly communicate ideas or issues
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools like Jira/Confluence, Miro etc.


**Additional Information**
 Working with tech at H&M Group
   

  

 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30th of June. We will review and interview applicants on-going. If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Hranda Khrystyna at khrystyna.hranda@hm.com
